description: This animal is a large herbivore native to North America, known for its massive head and shaggy mane.
The name 'buffalo' is often used to refer to this animal, although it is not a true buffalo.
This animal once roamed the Great Plains in vast herds, but their numbers were greatly reduced due to hunting and habitat loss.
This is the largest animal known to have ever existed, reaching lengths of up to 100 feet and a weight of up to 200 tons.
These marine mammals are found in oceans worldwide and primarily feed on tiny shrimp-like animals called krill.
Despite their massive size, these animals are known for their gentle nature and are often observed breaching and tail-slapping.
